results.title: Butch minds the baby
results.creator_credit: Peter Webb, Adrian Hughes and Park Village Productions
results.brief_description: A humorous film based on a short story by Damon Runyon and told through voice-over narration. This film is set in Manhattan in the summer of 1931 when the unemployment situation drives a bunch of hoodlums to approach famous safe-cracker Big Butch with a plan: if he carries out a job they have arranged, they will split the payoff. Butch foresees just one complication, his wife is away for the evening and he is babysitting John Ignatius Jnr.

results.title: Bunraku: puppet theatre of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Traditional performances at the Bunraku-za Theatre, Osaka, show the style of this unusual 18th century form, still popular in Japan. The Bunraku dolls, half life-size, create a make-believe world peculiar to Japan, and are so delicate that they cannot be imitated by live actors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures

results.title: Bunny
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Lynch and Philip Ellery
results.brief_description: In this engaging short drama, Jane is convinced that her dog has killed the neighbours’ pet rabbit! In fact, the rabbit died of natural causes and was given a decent burial…. Jane deals with the problem with the naive resourcefulness of a young girl, much to the horror of her neighbours!

results.title: Bunker Hill, 1956
results.creator_credit: Kent Mackenzie, Merl Edelman and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: A study of the people who live in the downtown section of Los Angeles called Bunker Hill. Presents a typical day in their lives and the problems they must face when uprooted by the razing of the section for building offices. Uses recorded voices of the residents. Makes a plea for the preservation of Bunker Hill.

results.title: Bull ant warriors
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Study of the chemistry and behaviour of the Australian Red Bull Ant being undertaken by a research team in which a colony of ants is re-established in the laboratory under controlled conditions. Using close-up photography, dissection techniques and behavioural experiments research is undertaken in developing methods of control by other than chemical means. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Building synergy
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the co-operative action in Victoria between schools and the community for use of facilities such as halls, libraries and theatres. Schools designed with community use in mind are working very successfully, with co-ordination of facilities between school and community. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Building Lindy's house
results.brief_description: Illustrates the selection of a block of land suitable for building a home. Shows the specialised work of different tradesmen employed in building a house and points out how the different building processes are co-ordinated.

results.title: Budget cuts
results.brief_description: Produced by Oxo, in association with the National Federation of Meat Traders Association, this is a demonstration of cooking, and the attractive arrangement of low-cost dishes. A butcher explains and shows various cuts of meat; emphasizes the value of cheaper cuts and how they can be used to advantage. No other credits available.
